summary:
The Security Council:
 
 Calls for a Yemeni-led political transition through the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) initiative, urging all parties to commit to its implementation.
 
 Demands Yemeni authorities ensure compliance with international humanitarian and human rights law, protect civilians, and allow peaceful assembly and freedom of expression.
 
 Calls for protection of women and children, and encourages equal participation of women in decision-making.
 
 Urges opposition groups to commit to a peaceful and constructive role in the political settlement, refrain from violence, and cease using force.
 
 Demands armed groups remove weapons from demonstration areas, refrain from violence, and not target vital infrastructure.
 
 Expresses concern over Al-Qaida's presence in Yemen and vows to address the threat in accordance with the UN Charter and international law.
 
 Encourages humanitarian assistance to Yemen, and requests facilitation of UN agencies' work and access to those in need.
 
 Requests the Secretary-General to continue his Good Offices, report on implementation within 30 days, and every 60 days thereafter.
 
 Decides to remain seized of the matter.
